title: What is the essence of human existence and its relationship with the four elements?
first_phrase: This text discusses the concept of the four elements - earth, water, air, and fire - which are said to be the same essence with different faces. It also explores the idea that humans are a perfect representation of this essence, containing all four elements within themselves. In the last 200 words, the text delves further into the idea that humans can assume all forms and appearances within these elements. The text references philosophers who divide the elements into three (water, fire and earth) and one (the special fifth, representing the intelligence of the human spirit). The fifth element is represented by the Spirit of Intelligence, which is infinite and perfect, representing the true essence of human existence.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the human essence or the First Virtue of man is the infinitely intelligent Spirit Intelligence. It represents in each person what they are, and it is the light of visible and hidden things, good and evil, and Truth in its most perfect and complete form. Although some believe that if everyone had this infinite intelligent Spirit, all humans would become gods, they forget that the manifestations of this Spirit are also shaped by opposing elements. For in the Universe, things become discernible only through a struggle of opposites, as light and shadow contend for supremacy.
